org.openxava.web.layout.impl

Class DefaultLayoutPainter

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.openxava.web.layout.AbstractBasePainter
      • org.openxava.web.layout.AbstractJspPainter
        • org.openxava.web.layout.impl.DefaultLayoutPainter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, ILayoutPainter

    public class DefaultLayoutPainter
extends AbstractJspPainter
    Implements a basic Painter.
    Author:
    Federico Alcantara

        Parameters:
        currentColumnsCount - Number of columns so far displayed

      • beginColumn

        public void beginColumn(ILayoutColumnBeginElement element)
        Each column does not open a table element (TD), this is done by the startCell method. However, each column can contain more than one cell, but only three TD elements are allowed in the column, so the first cell creates one TD for the left spacer, another TD for the label and a final TD for the data and any other remaining cell of the column. By parsing contiguous cells without labels are considered as part of the column.
        In this implementation columns are composed of three TD.
        See Also:
        org.openxava.web.layout.ILayoutPainter#beginColumn(org.openxava.web.layout.LayoutElement)

      • endColumn

        public void endColumn(ILayoutColumnEndElement element)
        In this painter implementation the column does end the last TD. So the cell implementation must start the first TD but NOT close the last one
        See Also:
        org.openxava.web.layout.ILayoutPainter#endColumn(org.openxava.web.layout.LayoutElement)

                      java.lang.String sentLabel)
        Display the given label. It only prints it if the label is printable.
        Parameters:

        sentLabel - Label to print, might be a blank or null value.

      • endProperty

        public void endProperty(ILayoutPropertyEndElement element)
        In this implementation nothing is done at cell end.
        See Also:
        org.openxava.web.layout.ILayoutPainter#endProperty(org.openxava.web.layout.LayoutElement)

      • beginCollection

        public void beginCollection(ILayoutCollectionBeginElement element)
        Besides the frame handling, it lets the collection.jsp to take care of the collection rendering.
        See Also:
        org.openxava.web.layout.ILayoutPainter#beginCollection(org.openxava.web.layout.LayoutElement)

      • endCollection

        public void endCollection(ILayoutCollectionEndElement element)
        Actually all code is performed in the startCollection method. However for future implementations this might be useful for adding features to the collection that might be painted at end of the collection renderization.
        See Also:
        org.openxava.web.layout.ILayoutPainter#endCollection(org.openxava.web.layout.LayoutElement)

      • beginSections

        public void beginSections(ILayoutSectionsBeginElement element)
        Each section behave as a marker. This is called upon section change or page reload.
        See Also:
        org.openxava.web.layout.ILayoutPainter#beginSections(org.openxava.web.layout.LayoutElement)
